intro: Clutia whytei, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Clutia whytei typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are follicles that release seeds with silky hairs.
